revised_title: Thermal Adjustment and Respiratory Exchange in Monotremes and Marsupials: A Study in the Development of Homothermism
tldr: This study investigates the thermal adjustment and respiratory exchange in monotremes and marsupials, comparing their ability to maintain body temperature in varying environments. Echidna and Ornithorhyncus exhibit different methods of heat regulation, while marsupials show evidence of utilizing variations in heat loss. The development of mechanisms controlling heat production and loss has allowed warm-blooded animals to adapt to a wider range of temperatures.
